attributes.action: International Examination boards to cancel exams in the United Kingdom 2021
attributes.additional_details: Because it is unsafe and unfair for certain students to be forced to take exams when others do not simply based on the course they chose. No one could have foreseen the past year and a half and as such, students must not face the consequences of the actions of privatised examination boards because of the current pandemic circumstances.
attributes.background: Cancel any international examinations, e.g.  Pre-U cambridge exams, IGCSE, International Baccalaureate, etc.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons are directly responsible for.

The International Baccalaureate is an international programme offered by independent providers, so decisions about any changes to the courses offered would be a matter for each provider, not the Government or House of Commons. Similarly, pre-entry exams held by individual universities are a matter for those univiersities.
